019package org.jgrapes.mail;
020
021import jakarta.mail.Address;
022import jakarta.mail.Authenticator;
023import jakarta.mail.Message;
024import jakarta.mail.MessagingException;
025import jakarta.mail.NoSuchProviderException;
026import jakarta.mail.PasswordAuthentication;
027import jakarta.mail.Session;
028import jakarta.mail.Transport;
029import jakarta.mail.internet.MimeMessage;
030import java.util.Date;
031import java.util.Map;
032import java.util.Properties;
033import java.util.logging.Logger;
034import org.jgrapes.core.Channel;
035import org.jgrapes.core.Component;
036import org.jgrapes.core.Event;
037import org.jgrapes.core.Manager;
038import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.Handler;
039import org.jgrapes.core.annotation.HandlerDefinition.ChannelReplacements;
040import org.jgrapes.core.events.Start;
041import org.jgrapes.core.events.Stop;
042import org.jgrapes.mail.events.ReceivedMailMessage;
043import org.jgrapes.mail.events.SendMailMessage;
044import org.jgrapes.util.JsonConfigurationStore;
045import org.jgrapes.util.events.ConfigurationUpdate;
046
047/**
048 * A component that sends mail.
049 * The component uses [Jakarta Mail](https://eclipse-ee4j.github.io/mail/)
050 * to connect to a mail server.
051 */
052@SuppressWarnings("PMD.DataflowAnomalyAnalysis")
053public class SimpleMailSender extends Component {
054
055    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.FieldNamingConventions")
056    private static final Logger logger
057        = Logger.getLogger(SimpleMailSender.class.getName());
058
059    private final Properties mailProps = new Properties();
060    private String password;
061    private Session session;
062    private Transport transport;
063
064    /**
065     * Creates a new component with its channel set to itself.
066     */
067    public SimpleMailSender() {
068        // Nothing to do.
069    }
070
071    /**
072     * Creates a new component base with its channel set to the given 
073     * channel. As a special case {@link Channel#SELF} can be
074     * passed to the constructor to make the component use itself
075     * as channel. The special value is necessary as you 
076     * obviously cannot pass an object to be constructed to its 
077     * constructor.
078     *
079     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
080     * handlers listen on by default and that 
081     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
082     */
083    public SimpleMailSender(Channel componentChannel) {
084        super(componentChannel);
085    }
086
087    /**
088     * Creates a new component base like {@link #SimpleMailSender(Channel)}
089     * but with channel mappings for {@link Handler} annotations.
090     *
091     * @param componentChannel the channel that the component's
092     * handlers listen on by default and that 
093     * {@link Manager#fire(Event, Channel...)} sends the event to
094     * @param channelReplacements the channel replacements to apply
095     * to the `channels` elements of the {@link Handler} annotations
096     */
097    public SimpleMailSender(Channel componentChannel,
098            ChannelReplacements channelReplacements) {
099        super(componentChannel, channelReplacements);
100    }
101
102    /**
103     * Sets the password.
104     *
105     * @param password the new password
106     */
107    public SimpleMailSender setPassword(String password) {
108        this.password = password;
109        return this;
110    }
111
112    /**
113     * Sets the mail properties. See 
114     * [the Jakarta Mail](https://jakarta.ee/specifications/mail/2.0/apidocs/jakarta.mail/jakarta/mail/package-summary.html)
115     * documentation for available settings.
116     *
117     * @param props the props
118     * @return the mail monitor
119     */
120    public SimpleMailSender setMailProperties(Map<String, String> props) {
121        mailProps.putAll(props);
122        return this;
123    }
124
125    /**
126     * Configure the component, using any values found under the 
127     * {@link #componentPath()}. Properties for configuring
128     * Jakarta Mail are taken from a sub-section "`mail`". The
129     * valid keys are the properties defined for
130     * [Jakarta Mail](https://jakarta.ee/specifications/mail/2.0/apidocs/jakarta.mail/jakarta/mail/package-summary.html)
131     * with the prefix "`mail.`" removed to avoid unnecessary redundancy.
132     * 
133     * Here's an example configuration file for the 
134     * {@link JsonConfigurationStore}.
135     * 
136     * ```json
137     * {
138     *     "/SendMail": {
139     *         "/MailSender": {
140     *             "/mail": {
141     *                 "host": "...",
142     *                 "transport.protocol": "smtp",
143     *                 "smtp.ssl.enable": "true",
144     *                 "smtp.port": 465,
145     *                 "smtp.auth": true,
146     *                 "user": "...",
147     *                 "debug": true
148     *              },
149     *              "password": "..."
150     *         }
151     *     }
152     * }
153     * ```
154     *
155     * @param event the event
156     */
157    @Handler
158    public void onConfigUpdate(ConfigurationUpdate event) {
159        event.values(componentPath()).ifPresent(c -> {
160            setPassword(c.get("password"));
161        });
162        event.values(componentPath() + "/mail").ifPresent(c -> {
163            for (var e : c.entrySet()) {
164                mailProps.put("mail." + e.getKey(), e.getValue());
165            }
166        });
167    }
168
169    /**
170     * Run the monitor.
171     *
172     * @param event the event
173     * @throws NoSuchProviderException 
174     */
175    @Handler
176    public void onStart(Start event) throws NoSuchProviderException {
177        session = Session.getInstance(mailProps, new Authenticator() {
178            @Override
179            protected PasswordAuthentication
180                    getPasswordAuthentication() {
181                return new PasswordAuthentication(
182                    mailProps.getProperty("mail.user"), password);
183            }
184        });
185        transport = session.getTransport();
186    }
187
188    @Handler
189    public void onMessage(SendMailMessage event) throws MessagingException {
190        Message msg = new MimeMessage(session);
191        if (event.from() != null) {
192            msg.setFrom(event.from());
193        } else {
194            msg.setFrom();
195        }
196        msg.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.TO,
197            event.to().toArray(new Address[0]));
198//        msg.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.CC,
199//            event.cc().toArray(new Address[0]));
200//        msg.setRecipients(Message.RecipientType.BCC,
201//            event.bcc().toArray(new Address[0]));
202        msg.setSentDate(new Date());
203        for (var header : event.headers().entrySet()) {
204            msg.setHeader(header.getKey(), header.getValue());
205        }
206        msg.setSubject(event.subject());
207        msg.setText("Test");
208//        msg.setContent(event.body());
209
210        if (!transport.isConnected()) {
211            transport.connect();
212        }
213        Transport.send(msg);
214    }
215
216    /**
217     * Stop the monitor.
218     *
219     * @param event the event
220     */
221    @Handler
222    @SuppressWarnings("PMD.GuardLogStatement")
223    public void onStop(Stop event) {
224    }
225
226}
